Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2014 05:02PM - edited Dec 31, 2014 05:03PM by mcj The specialist said by feeling the lump it has smooth edges and is moveable which is a good sign. Something has just felt off for the past six months. I've gone to the doctors multiple times for just being tired all the time but it's like they don't take me seriously. And now I have I'm lump. I guess the doctor from the ultrasound freaked me out.
Posts.Title: Two doctors each different results. mcj mcj

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2015 01:39PM - edited Jan 2, 2015 01:40PM by mcj I am so sorry all of you have had to go through this... And thank you all the advice! I went ahead and got the ultrasound report and after reading it and reading what all you have wrote I have decided to get the lump taken out completely and biopsied. The report said that there are ill defined margins and internal vascular flow is detected and that cancer should not be ruled out. The ultrasound doctor and the breast specialist obviously have different opinions so I need to look into it further. And if it is nothing at least I can finally put my mind at ease. Thank you all again for the help.
Posts.Title: Two doctors each different results. mcj mcj

Posts.Content: mcj wrote: Hello, I had an ultrasound done at the hospital because of a lump in my breast. The doctor there said it did not look normal and wanted me to get a biopsy done to rule out cancer. The results were sent to my general practitioner who referred me to a specialist. He looked at the ultrasound and examined my breast and said it is a fibroadenoma and just to monitor it. I am only 23 but bc does run in my family. Why would one doctor be worried and the other one blow it off? Should I demand a biopsy? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Two doctors each different results. mcj mcj
